# Roleplay Rule 5 – Respect the Safezone (Arrivals & Cryo)
The arrivals shuttle, its docking area, cryo bays, and the immediate surroundings form the **Safezone**. This area exists so players can spawn, load in, take a short AFK, sort themselves out, and join the round without being put in danger.
Because Prospect Sector is a **cooperative, progression-focused game with no antagonist roles**, any hostile or disruptive behavior in the Safezone is strictly prohibited.
The Safezone must always remain: - Safe to spawn in - Safe to pause in briefly - Free of hazards, traps, or environmental sabotage - Free of harassment, baiting, or grief
The Safezone **must not be damaged, blocked, sabotaged, or used as a staging point for harmful behavior**, even indirectly. You may decorate, organize, and lightly modify the Safezone, as long as it remains fully safe and functional.
## Examples
### Acceptable: - Redecorating or visually customizing the Safezone. - Expanding or remodeling the area **without** introducing hazards. - Placing information boards, job guides, or wayfinding signs. - Setting up a small **non-intrusive** checkpoint or welcome desk. - Building light-quality-of-life improvements (charging station, disposals, benches). - Temporarily moving items as long as the Safezone remains safe and accessible.
### Prohibited: - Making the Safezone uninhabitable (fires, no air, leaks, broken floors). - Damaging the arrivals shuttle or cryo bays. - Placing traps, harmful machines, or environmental hazards. - Blocking exits or sealing players inside the shuttle. - Killing, attacking, or harassing players in or immediately after leaving the Safezone. - Removing firelocks, alarms, or atmos safety devices. - Electrifying doors, sabotaging vents, or altering atmos pipelines connected to the Safezone. - Using construction tools to wall off or isolate arriving players. - Dragging hostile mobs, explosives, or environmental dangers into the area.
## Special Note Prospect Sector has **no antagonist roles**. Therefore, there are **no exemptions** that allow you to damage or endanger the Safezone.
The Safezone is always protected, regardless of round, job, or situation.
